title: American Revolution
description: Colonies in North America revolted against British rule, leading to independence and the United States; significant political innovations in republican government.

title: French Revolution
description: Overthrew the Bourbon monarchy, established a republic, and led to radical social and political change across Europe; key phases include the National Assembly, Reign of Terror, and rise of Napoleon.

title: Haitian Revolution
description: Slave revolt in Saint-Domingue that led to the first independent Black republic and ended slavery there; had major impact on Atlantic slavery and politics.

title: Revolutions of 1848
description: A wave of liberal and nationalist uprisings across Europe seeking constitutional government, national unification, and social reform; most were suppressed but they reshaped politics.

title: Mexican Revolution
description: A complex civil war that led to land reform, new constitution (1917), and major social change; ended long-standing dictatorship and reshaped Mexican society.

title: Russian Revolution
description: February and October revolutions ended the Romanov monarchy and brought the Bolsheviks to power, leading to the creation of the Soviet Union and global ideological shifts.

title: Xinhai Revolution (1911)
description: Revolution that overthrew the Qing dynasty and established the Republic of China, ending over two millennia of imperial rule.

title: Iranian Revolution
description: Mass protests and political movement that overthrew the Pahlavi monarchy and established the Islamic Republic under Ayatollah Khomeini.
